sentence1: David noticed he had put on a lot of weight recently.
sentence2: He examined his habits to try and figure out the reason.
sentence3: He realized he'd been eating too much fast food lately.
sentence4: He stopped going to burger places and started a vegetarian diet.
sentence5: After a few weeks, he started to feel much better.

sentence1: Tom had a very short temper.
sentence2: One day a guest made him very angry.
sentence3: He punched a hole in the wall of his house.
sentence4: Tom's guest became afraid and left quickly.
sentence5: Tom sat on his couch filled with regret about his actions.

sentence1: Marcus needed clothing for a business casual event.
sentence2: All of his clothes were either too formal or too casual.
sentence3: He decided to buy a pair of khakis.
sentence4: The pair he bought fit him perfectly.
sentence5: Marcus was happy to have the right clothes for the event.

sentence1: Bobby thought Bill should buy a trailer and haul it with his car.
sentence2: Bill thought a truck would be better for what he needed.
sentence3: Bobby pointed out two vehicles were much more expensive.
sentence4: Bill was set in his ways with conventional thinking.
sentence5: He ended up buying the truck he wanted despite Bobby's advice.

sentence1: John was a pastor with a very bad memory.
sentence2: He tried to memorize his sermons many days in advance but to no avail.
sentence3: He decided to learn to sing to overcome his handicap.
sentence4: He then made all his sermons into music and sang them on Sundays.
sentence5: His congregation was delighted and so was he.

sentence1: Melody's parents surprised her with a trip to the big aquarium.
sentence2: Melody took a nap during the two hour car ride to the aquarium.
sentence3: When they arrived, Melody was energetic and excited.
sentence4: At the aquarium Melody saw sharks, tropical fish and many others.
sentence5: After five hours at the aquarium, Melody and her family drove home.

sentence1: The math teacher announced a pop quiz as class began.
sentence2: While some students complained, he began passing out the quiz.
sentence3: I took out my pencil and began to work.
sentence4: About 5 minutes later, I finished.
sentence5: I stood up feeling confident and turned it in.

sentence1: My first girlfriend i met on the internet.
sentence2: She lives about 4 hours away from me.
sentence3: Finally after 2 years we met each other.
sentence4: She stayed with me for a week or two.
sentence5: We decided we couldn't be apart so she moved in with me.

sentence1: I got Charlie Horse when I was four years old.
sentence2: He's a brown stuffed horse, and at 35 I still sleep with him at night.
sentence3: He was my best friend, and always laid at the head of my bed.
sentence4: I laid him next to me, smelling his soft fur every night.
sentence5: I liked to listen to my radio as I fell asleep cuddling him.

sentence1: Laura loved corn.
sentence2: So she decided to grow some in her backyard.
sentence3: The whole process of growing them made her very excited.
sentence4: But she realized that they required too much water.
sentence5: So Laura quickly abandoned her corn garden idea.

sentence1: Andy was invited to a Halloween party.
sentence2: Andy figured that for dramatic effect, he should color his hair.
sentence3: Since Andy's costume was green, Andy decided on that color.
sentence4: After the stylist finished the coloring, Andy regretted it.
sentence5: Andy was disappointed with his new, bold, green hair color.

sentence1: Luke was playing hockey at school.
sentence2: The game was tied and almost over.
sentence3: Then Luke made the winning shot!
sentence4: Everybody cheered!
sentence5: Luke was so proud of himself!

sentence1: Robbie was competing in a cross country meet.
sentence2: He was halfway through when his leg cramped up.
sentence3: Robbie wasn't sure he could go on.
sentence4: He stopped for a minute and stretched his bad leg.
sentence5: Robbie began to run again and finished the race in second place.

sentence1: Jude was very excited about his college graduation ceremony.
sentence2: On the way to the arena, he got stuck in traffic.
sentence3: He only had an hour before the ceremony started.
sentence4: He thought he wasn't going to be able to make it in time.
sentence5: Luckily, the traffic cleared up in time for him to get to the ceremony.

sentence1: Beth sent a letter to Santa Claus.
sentence2: She received a letter back in the mail.
sentence3: Beth did not think that it sounded like the real Santa.
sentence4: She sent another letter calling that Santa a fake.
sentence5: She did not receive another letter back in the mail.

sentence1: Our granddaughter Anna is very fussy about her clothes.
sentence2: She is only two, but wants to pick her outfits.
sentence3: Today her mom wanted Anna to wear a dress.
sentence4: Anna started crying.
sentence5: They let her wear a t-shirt and shorts instead.

sentence1: Jake needed a ride to the store.
sentence2: His girlfriend was working and wouldn't take him.
sentence3: His brother was in the middle of a movie and said no.
sentence4: Jake decided to take the bus to the store.
sentence5: He got what he needed all by himself.

sentence1: I'd been looking for a stand for my TV.
sentence2: I looked everywhere, but the ones I saw were expensive.
sentence3: I happened upon a yard sale on my way home.
sentence4: She had a stand that was perfect, and cheap.
sentence5: It looks great in my den.

sentence1: Sally had a root canal this morning, as she had a damaged root.
sentence2: After the procedure, the dentist wrote her a prescription.
sentence3: She headed straight to the pharmacy to fill her medication.
sentence4: She handed the prescription to the technician and waited patiently.
sentence5: The technician called her name and she paid for the prescription.

sentence1: My dog is terrified of thunder.
sentence2: There was a storm today.
sentence3: He came running into my office.
sentence4: He hid in the kneehole of my desk, trembling.
sentence5: Once the storm was over, he acted like a brave dog again.

sentence1: Mark and Jo were brainstorming ideas for a children's show.
sentence2: Mark suggested that a monster attacks the children.
sentence3: Jo laughed because he thought Mark was joking.
sentence4: Mark was confused because he thought it was a great idea.
sentence5: Mark left in a huff for having his ideas mocked.

sentence1: Ben's Boy Scout Troop worked for weeks on a float.

sentence3: They got it finished just in time.
sentence4: It was big enough for his whole troop to ride on.
sentence5: They felt proud as they went down the street as people clapped.

sentence1: Francis has always wanted to learn how to tie a necktie.
sentence2: He decides to practice until he can tie one.
sentence3: At first he finds it very difficult.
sentence4: But eventually he is able to tie a necktie very well.
sentence5: Francis is proud of himself for learning how to tie a necktie.

sentence1: Eric and his wife had a daughter named Meg.
sentence2: Eric's wife passed away.
sentence3: Eric and Meg were very sad.
sentence4: Eric met a woman and married her 5 years after his wife died.
sentence5: Meg is now happy with her new stepmother.

sentence1: My cousin took me to a local restaurant.
sentence2: We ordered a large pizza.
sentence3: Since she never tasted the food there, she didn't know if it was good.
sentence4: I began to start sneezing.
sentence5: To make matters worse, I caught an allergy.

sentence1: When I was 12 years old, my dad got angry and kicked me aggressively.
sentence2: Afterward, I became very ill, and tasted something metallic.
sentence3: I went to a doctor, and was informed that one of my kidneys was dead.
sentence4: Ever since, I've had swelling and hypertension.
sentence5: I started taking medications to combat the symptoms at 13.

sentence1: Fred noticed that he feet got very hot in the summer.
sentence2: He decided he needed new footwear.
sentence3: Fred invested in a nice new pair of sandals.
sentence4: He loved wearing his new sandals.
sentence5: Fred was glad that his feet no longer got hot in the summer.

sentence1: Last year I took a day trip to see a friend in Maine.
sentence2: I took the Amtrak from Boston to Saco, Maine.
sentence3: We had lunch at Gritty's in Portland.
sentence4: My friend drove me back to the train station.
sentence5: I had a nice time and will visit my friend this year.

storytitle: Heather cooks Tacos for the first time.
sentence1: Heather and her family really wanted tacos for dinner.
sentence2: Two of the children wanted chicken tacos.
sentence3: The other two children wanted beef.
sentence4: Heather took great care preparing all the tacos that each wanted.
sentence5: Everyone sat down at dinner and enjoyed eating the tacos together.

sentence1: Anna was filling her bird feeders.
sentence2: But a chunk of suet fell onto the ground.
sentence3: Her dog rushed over and lapped it up!
sentence4: Anna was astonished.
sentence5: She had no idea dogs loved bird food!

sentence1: James had an Xbox 360.
sentence2: His friends had Xbox accounts online.
sentence3: James registered, but was still unable to connect online.
sentence4: He called for tech support, but they couldn't help either.
sentence5: He realized he would need a new Xbox.

sentence1: The people gathered to protest the court's ruling last week.
sentence2: They held signs and chanted loudly.
sentence3: The police stormed in and arrested them all.
sentence4: Now there are more protests in surrounding towns.
sentence5: The movement is gaining momentum!

sentence1: My roommate and I bought a new futon for our living room.
sentence2: The futon came in a huge box.
sentence3: We set the box out on the curb to be picked up on trash day.
sentence4: Much to our chagrin, the garbage men left the box on the curb.
sentence5: We had to take the box to the dump ourselves.

sentence1: Bob chased after the rainbow through the fields.
sentence2: He ran after it over forests and streams.
sentence3: Bob thought he'd lost it behind a boulder.
sentence4: He found it waiting for him on the other side.
sentence5: When Bob dived for the pot of gold, he woke up.

sentence1: Soren ran through the airport, pulling her bags behind her.

sentence3: She yelled for them to wait as she neared her gate, waving her arms.
sentence4: The attendant at the desk gave Soren a sad, sympathetic look.
sentence5: Nearly out of breath, Soren presented her pass and boarded the plane.

sentence1: Charles had always wanted to have a college degree.

sentence3: Finally he turned in his last college essay.
sentence4: All of his family attended his college graduation.
sentence5: Charles was proud that he had a college degree.

sentence1: Stacy originally thought she wanted five kids.

sentence3: Two years later, they had twin girls.
sentence4: Now, Stacy is selling all her maternity and baby clothes.
sentence5: She says she has changed her mind about wanting five kids!

sentence1: Lance was going to make a bet.

sentence1: Larry worked at an accounting firm.
sentence2: It was a boring job but it paid the bills.
sentence3: Larry grew tired of doing the same thing every day.

sentence5: By lunch the whole office had passed out and nothing got done.

sentence1: Ava was six years old.

sentence5: Soon Ava was paddling all by herself!

sentence1: James was walking down a street one afternoon.

sentence5: The old man had called to thank James for returning his wallet.

sentence1: Chad's dog would always jump on people.

sentence4: The trainer taught the dog how to behave.
sentence5: Chad was proud to finally show off his dog to others.

sentence1: Karl was a good baseball player in his youth.

sentence3: Karl is very competitive and will do anything to win.
sentence4: One day, he slid into second base to beat a throw and hurt his knee.

sentence1: Nick was trying to buy a house.

sentence3: His stuff always ended up missing from his bedroom.
sentence4: He knew it had to be Nick so he decided he would move out.

sentence1: Jody bought a goldfish from the pet store.

sentence3: Her mom told her that the goldfish had too much to eat.

sentence5: The goldfish got skinnier and healthier.

sentence1: Jane had recently gotten a new job.

sentence1: Jill was going on a trip to the amazon.

sentence1: Chris is a defense attorney.

sentence1: Julie was feeling hungry.

sentence1: Justin was terrified of dogs.
